title: println!()
description:
An important standerd library macro(i will explain later) is **println!()**.
println!() prints to console. 
You just type println!() and inside you put what you want to print.
 When printing a variable, all you do is put a variable inside(once again, i will explain variables later), or quotes and text inside the quotes if you are printing normal text. 
The ! specifices its a macro. println is not anything, 
println!() is a mcaro(and more importantly output).

The Verdigris OS test release exposed a "bug". Somebody **Deleted** the bootup code. Write the main functino, and inside make it print "> user-default00001"
